question: Which section of the Representation of Peoples Act, 1951 says that the expenditure incurred by leaders of a political party on account of travel by air or by any other means of transport for propagating programme of the political party is not considered to be the election expenditure?
explanation: The Section 77 of the Representation of Peoples Act, 1951 says that the expenditure incurred by leaders of a political party on account of travel by air or by any other means of transport for propagating programme of the political party is not considered to be the election expenditure.
